question_text:
Question 17 
[RCC Structures : Column & Footing] 
 
 
 
 
The following figure shows the arrangement of formwork for casting a cantilever RC beam.

Cantilever RC Beam
RC Column
S1
S2
S3
S4
S5
S1, S2, S3, S4, S5
are Shores/Props
Compacted Ground
The correct sequence of removing the Shores/Props is 
 
(A) S1→S2→S3→S4→S5
(B) S5→S4→S3→S2→S1
(C) S3→S2→S4→S1→S5
(D) S3→S4→S2→S5→S1
explanation_text:
Sol. 
While removing the props, we need to
 
ensure that the beam type does not change i.e., if it is a cantilever 
beam then the props shall be removed in such a manner that the beam at the intermediate stage also shows 
cantilever behavior. 
 
If we remove prop ‘S1’ first then tensile stress will be generated at the bottom and no structural 
reinforcement is there to take care of this tension. 
 
So, correct order is 
S5
S4
S3
S2
S1





PAGE
13

Hence, the correct option is (B). 
Question 18 
 
[Geotechnical Engineering : Shallow Foundation] 
 
A 2 m wide strip footing is founded at a depth of 1.5 m below the ground level in a homogeneous pure 
clay bed. The clay bed has unit cohesion of 40 kPa. Due to seasonal fluctuations of water table from peak 
summer to peak monsoon period, the net ultimate bearing capacity of the footing, as per Terzaghi’s theory, 
will 
 
(A) remain the same 
(B) decrease  
 
(C) increase 
(D) become zero 
 
Ans. (A)
